Issues.Title: APP_INITIALIZER functions differently in unit tests vs normal build, not waiting for promise
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/.... @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Not that I'm aware of ### Description When you bootstrap your app using an async app initializer, the app will wait until the promise resolves before finishing the bootstrap process. However, when in unit tests, async app initializers are not awaited. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/ChristopherKiss/angular-app-initializer You can see the output from my repo here: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24984762/64088797-81e39c00-cd86-11e9-93d2-f20b54d1fd54.png) ## üî• Exception or Error N/A ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 8.1.3
Node: 12.9.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.1.3
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.801.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.801.3
@angular-devkit/core              8.1.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.1.3
@ngtools/webpack                  8.1.3
@schematics/angular               8.1.3
@schematics/update                0.801.3
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.4.5
webpack                           4.35.2
**Anything else relevant?** Comparing the bootstrap process, we can see the promise is waited to resolve. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1537791f06df5d85dd27e763836fd99bb1530991/packages/core/src/application_ref.ts#L282-L286 However, in unit tests, it is not waited for. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1537791f06df5d85dd27e763836fd99bb1530991/packages/core/testing/src/test_bed.ts#L380 In the testbed, the initIfNeeded function is called from inject, execute or createComponent function. We see that initializers are run inside this function: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1537791f06df5d85dd27e763836fd99bb1530991/packages/core/testing/src/test_bed.ts#L415-L416 But never waited to resolve first before continuing. Finally, the documentation is quite slim in this area: https://angular.io/api/core/APP_INITIALIZER https://angular.io/guide/dependency-injection-providers#predefined-tokens-and-multiple-providers What order do multi initializers run in? Do they run in parallel or do they wait for each other?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "APP_INITIALIZER functions differently in unit tests vs normal build, not waiting for promise" (#32441)

Issues.Title: Fix Back Button - Load the last state of the component when back button is clicked, just like a normal web page.
Issues.Body:
### Description
When we go forward, the state and position of the last component is reset every time. this is making too much trouble making the back button work.


### I would like having
Create a new parameter to cache or not cache the previous page. we only need this for a very few pages like search page etc. Too much time is lost figuring this out. if the back button worked just normally like any other normal webpage. that is very useful.

### Alternatives
popup and the new window is currently used. but does not serve the purpose efficiently.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix Back Button - Load the last state of the component when back button is clicked, just like a normal web page." (#32455)

Issues.Title: NgFor (and IterableDiffer) should support Map as input
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ NgFor should support Map as input (it‚Äôs iterable)

### Relevant Package
`@angular/core`

### Description
When passing a Map to `ngFor`, you get: `Cannot find a differ supporting object '[object Map]' of type 'object'`.

This is confusing, since a Map *is* Iterable, and (AFAICT) adheres to the `NgIterable` interface. I‚Äôd expect the `ngFor` to "just" iterate on the `[key, value]` array.

I believe the issue is within IterableDiffer.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I‚Äôd like to be able to pass a `Map` to `IterableDiffers.find` (or `ngFor`) and for it to work.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
You could try to use the `keyvalue` pipe but:

- It does not preserve order (http://go/ngissue/31420)
- The pipe is not pure, and can be somewhat heavy duty

You could also just use `myMap.entries()`, but this returns a new object on every call, which could create some churn during change detection.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NgFor (and IterableDiffer) should support Map as input" (#32446)

Issues.Title: No way to pass custom typescript transformers through angular.json to AngularCompilerPlugin
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I want to pass platformTransformers property to AngularCompilerPlugin through angular.json, but i can't find any option for it. I can only pass it directly to private property _transformers now using "customWebpackConfig" ``` const { AngularCompilerPlugin } = require('@ngtools/webpack'); const { MyTransformer } = require('./transformers'); module.exports = function (baseConfig, opts) { const AngularCompilerPluginInstance = baseConfig.plugins.find(plugin => plugin instanceof AngularCompilerPlugin); const defaultsTransformers = AngularCompilerPluginInstance._transformers; AngularCompilerPluginInstance._transformers = [MyTransformer, ...defaultsTransformers]; return baseConfig; } ``` So i think we need something like platformTransformers property (like we can use it with lazyModules property and pass it to AngularCompiler additionalLazyModules) in angular.json, and it will contains path to the file with transformers ``` "platformTransformers:" "./transformers.ts" ``` and transformers.ts is ``` module.exports = [MyTransformer1, MyTransformer2, ...] ``` I can make a PR. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): add definitions for styleUrls
Issues.Body:
Adds support for `styleUrls` definitions in the same way `templateUrl`
definitions are provided; clicking on styleUrl will take a user to the
respective file.

Unifies some code in determining a URL definition. We first check if a
url is a `templateUrl`; if it's not, we check that it's a `styleUrl` or
return no definitions.

Issues.Title: FormArray & ControlValueAccessor does not pass through validation when sub component appears.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? No Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... In a complex form environment, i have a formarray inside a ControlValueAccessor (CVA), and another CVA with some internal validation. The CVA with internal validation is shown optionally with an ngIf, and can be activated from the same FormGroup in the FormArray. If i use the CVA in a FormArray that's directly connected to the main Form, the main form becomes invalid when the CVA appears, and valid when the CVA is removed. However, when i use the same construction, but the FormArray is also in a CVA, the main form does not become invalid when the CVA appears. in both situation the statusChanges event emitter is not activated, until the CVA with the validation is interacted with. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/github/gerhardboer/formarray-cva-bug the Broken module shows the issue the Working module shows it working when no CVA boundary is present. ## üî• Exception or Error the main form does not become invalid when a CVA with internal validation is added from a FormArray from a CVA ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular 8
**Anything else relevant?** This issue might be related: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/14542
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FormArray & ControlValueAccessor does not pass through validation when sub component appears." (#32454)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): guard directive-related operations with a TNode flag
Issues.Body: There are multiple places where we call directive-related functions on a node. In real-life applications many nodes won't be a host for any directive, so often times those calls are wasteful. This PR introduces a new flag for `TNode` (`isDirectiveHost `) and ensures that any directive-related logic execution is guarded by this new flag.

Issues.Title: Fix for 2 years old issue StaticInjectorError error when `--bundle-dependencies=all`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

This is about the issue reported at https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/8616 .

Its a 2 years old issue with still no fix from Angular team. Since that issue has been closed, I am creating a new issue.

When we set `"bundleDependencies": "all",` in `angular.json` file, which we normally do for SSR/Universal apps (specifically for .net/.net core applications its required), and also have `"optimization": true,`. The generated bundle throws below error:

```
NodeInvocationException: StaticInjectorError(AppServerModule)[InjectionToken Application Initializer -> InjectionToken DocumentToken]: 
StaticInjectorError(Platform: core)[InjectionToken Application Initializer -> InjectionToken DocumentToken]: 
Right-hand side of 'instanceof' is not an object
TypeError: StaticInjectorError(AppServerModule)[InjectionToken Application Initializer -> InjectionToken DocumentToken]: 
StaticInjectorError(Platform: core)[InjectionToken Application Initializer -> InjectionToken DocumentToken]: 
Right-hand side of 'instanceof' is not an object
```

I believe the reason of this is the compress and mangle option of `terser` plugin.

If we set `--keep-fnames` for `terser` plugin for server bundles or when using `"bundleDependencies": "all"`, this issue can be resolved.

> `--keep-fnames`  Do not mangle/drop function names.  Useful for code relying on Function.prototype.name.

I have verified this and it works as mentioned here https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/8616#issuecomment-526843717
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix for 2 years old issue StaticInjectorError error when `--bundle-dependencies=all` " (#15498)

Issues.Title: `ng update` migrations not working on npm linked custom schematics
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] update ``` ### Description I have custom schematics to generate a new application using `ng new -c my-custom-schematics`. I am attempting to add migrations so I can update my applications when the schematics are updated, using `ng update my-custom-schematics`. During development of these migrations, if I `npm link my-custom-schematics` in the generated application and run `ng update my-custom-schematics --migrate-only --from=1` I receive the error "Package found in package.json but is not installed." If I copy the package to the application's node_modules folder, it works fine. The problem only arises using `npm link`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1) Generate a new application using custom schematics. 2) Update the schematic to include migrations to a new version. 3) `npm link` the application to the new version of the schematics 4) Run `ng update my-custom-schematics --migrate-only --from=1` ## üî• Exception or Error 

Package found in package.json but is not installed.
**Anything else relevant?** Not receiving the error if I copy the package to the application's node_modules folder. Only occurs if the schematics package is npm linked.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`ng update` migrations not working on npm linked custom schematics" (#15511)

Issues.Title: ng serve doesn't support apps that use routes that don't begin with deployUrl
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report
In case you want to serve your static files with a prefix, and use deployUrl in the serve.options.deployUrl section and route to a route that doesn't begin with this deployUrl the index.html isn't served.


### Description
We want to serve all of our static files in the index.html with a certain prefix (to distinguish micro frontend apps with our proxy), for example:
'user-management'. We use deployUrl:'user-management' and reroute to localhost:8095://check/user-management/auth for example and the index.html isn't served (the route is registered as well)
In case you delete ** rewrites** attribute from historyApiFallback in node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/dev-server/index.js it works.
Playing with regex servePath didn't help.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://github.com/slavoroi/angular-cli-historyapifallback-rewrites-issue
1) npm i
2) ng serve
3) go to 'http://localhost:8095/check/user-management/auth' and index.html isn't served.
4) If you delete those lines it works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng serve doesn't support apps that use routes that don't begin with deployUrl" (#15506)

Issues.Title: Feature request to expose makeTransform and
Issues.Body:
Hello,

AngularCompilerPlugin allows users to create custom TypeScript transformers. Here is options: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/interfaces.ts#L66

I was playing with transformers and approach that plugin uses internally looks very handy.

I think it would be nice to expose this API to users.

I mean exposing: 

```
makeTransform
AddNodeOperation
RemoveNodeOperation
ReplaceNodeOperation
StandardTransform
```

If you don't mind, I can make a PR.

Issues.Title: build: update sass-loader to version 8.0.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [sass-loader](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader) | dependencies | major | [`7.3.1` -> `8.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass-loader/7.3.1/8.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/sass-loader</summary>

### [`v8.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​800httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribsass-loadercomparev731v800-2019-08-29)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/compare/v7.3.1...v8.0.0)

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum required `webpack` version is `4.36.0`
-   minimum required `node.js` version is `8.9.0`
-   move all sass (`includePaths`, `importer`, `functions`) options to the `sassOptions` option. The `functions` option can't be used as `Function`, you should use `sassOption` as `Function` to achieve this.
-   the `data` option was renamed to the `prependData` option
-   default value of the `sourceMap` option depends on the `devtool` value (`eval`/`false` values don't enable source map generation)

##### Features

-   automatically use the `fibers` package if it is possible ([#​744](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/issues/744)) ([96184e1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/96184e1))
-   source map generation depends on the `devtool` option ([#​743](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/issues/743)) ([fcea88e](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/fcea88e))
-   validate loader options ([#​737](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/issues/737)) ([7b543fc](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/7b543fc))
-   reworked error handling from `node-sass`/`sass`
-   improve resolution for `@import` (including support `_index` and `index` files in a directory)

##### Bug Fixes

-   compatibility with `pnp`

##### [7.3.1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/compare/v7.3.0...v7.3.1) (2019-08-20)

##### Bug Fixes

</details>

Issues.Title: ng lint param for parallel execution for fast CI builds
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
On a CI environment we often have machines with lots of cores. 
The Lint without project argument runs the jobs sequentially in one thread. 
This makes the whole process unnecessarily long. 
In our application we can get the lint time down to a third if we run them in paralel with a wait command at the end. 


### Describe the solution you'd like
A parameter '--parallel' on ng lint that runs all available parts like the parameterless version but in parallel with a wait at the end. 
For each individual job the outputs should be pushed once the job is done so the different jobs don' write across one another. 
Alternatively it could always be launched silently wihout outputs except success/failure at the end. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Handcrafting a job that explicitly calls all individual lints and joins them with a wait.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng lint param for parallel execution for fast CI builds" (#15482)

Issues.Title: MatTable with MatSort behaves strangely with Screen Readers
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using <table mat-table ... with a MatSort, the resulting table announces the Sort Button's aria-label as part of the table header.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Only the table header's initial text is announced by screenreaders

#### What is the current behavior?
Every 3rd row says "Name Change Sorting for ..."


#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Check this bug report from JAWS where I initially reported the issue. Firefox seems to work as expected, but JAWS on IE does not.

https://github.com/FreedomScientific/VFO-standards-support/issues/207

Navigate through this table with a screenreader. This table is a sanitized version of the output of MatTable
https://codepen.io/anon/pen/VJYaWq

Expected Header announced: "name"
Actual header announced "Name Change Sorting for..." (Not always, but some rows)


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
This will improve accessibility of MatTable

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
IE + JAWS
Chrome

(Not Firefox)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Someone from FreedomScientific already proposed a solution:
https://github.com/FreedomScientific/VFO-standards-support/issues/207
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTable with MatSort behaves strangely with Screen Readers" (#16968)

Issues.Title: build: do not include material prebuilt theme twice in legacy tests
Issues.Body:
Just something I noticed while investigating the MDC slider test failures on Edge BS..

Apparently we include the Angular Material prebuilt theme twice in the
legacy Karma tests. This is because we also generate a second folder
called `esm5` in the package output (for later use in the release
composing step). This folder also contains the prebuilt themes as
a side-effect of copying the assets for esm5 inlining/bundling.

In any case, we should not import the theme using a glob, but rather
use an explicit path (similar to how we do it for the mdc theme).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: do not include material prebuilt theme twice in legacy tests" (#16966)

consistent with what we did for the Bazel tests. It can cause
unexpected differences and confusion when debugging tests in
both Bazel and the legacy job (different visual output).

Issues.Title: fix(menu): restore focus immediately when menu is closed
Issues.Body:
Currently in some cases we restore focus immediately and in others we wait for the exit animation to finish (when using `matMenuContent`) because the focus restoration logic is coupled to the menu cleanup. This means that if multiple animations overlap, we could end up restoring focus to the wrong element. These changes switch to restoring focus immediately in all cases.

Fixes #16954.

Issues.Title: Icons are not rendered correctly from icon sets with svg sprites
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-gbzhv4

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an SVG sprite with `symbol` element with `viewBox` 
2. Register the icon set with MatIconRegistry
3. Use the icon with `mat-icon` and `svgIcon`

For me the stackblitz link is not working, but if you download the project, then you can check the issue with `npm install & ng serve`. 
 
#### Expected Behavior

SVG correctly rendered.

#### Actual Behavior

The SVG element is correctly placed inside the DOM, but the icon is not visible.

#### Probable root cause

If the viewbox is large enough, only the top left 24x24 pixels are shown on the screen. This is because the `viewBox` attribute is not copied from the symbol element. Manually adding it to the `svg` element in DevTools fixes the error.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.4
- CDK/Material: 8.1.4
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 76.0.3809.132 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 (Version 1809 Build 17763.678)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Icons are not rendered correctly from icon sets with svg sprites" (#16958)

Issues.Title: Use inline flex instead of flex on mat header row and mat row elements.
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

https://medium.com/@ole.ersoy/making-the-angular-material-data-table-rows-fit-content-f227f4d9355e

Right now, since the `mat-header-row` is a `flex` container it will only expand to fit the parent container, and if the `mat-header-cell`s are wider than that they will overflow the container.

#### Use Case

Allow the `mat-head-row` and `mat-row` to fit the content.

[See this SO for more details](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57773529/getting-a-flex-container-to-expand-to-fit-the-total-width-of-all-the-contained-i?noredirect=1#comment101982457_57773529)

And this one:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57764056/expanding-the-angular-material-data-table-header-row-to-match-row-content-width
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use inline flex instead of flex on mat header row and mat row elements." (#16959)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): allow ElementRef in RippleRenderer.setupTriggerEvents
Issues.Body: The way the `RippleRenderer` is set up at the moment is inconsistent from an API standpoint, because the constructor only accepts an `ElementRef`, whereas `setupTriggerEvents` only accepts an `HTMLElement`, and in most cases they're referring to the same DOM node. These changes make the two code paths consistent with each other by allowing `HTMLElement | ElementRef<HTMLElement>` in both of them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): allow ElementRef in RippleRenderer.setupTriggerEvents" (#16953)

Issues.Title: Adding mat-sort-header breaks the templates flex box layout.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Here's a stackblitz with the header column words centered using flexbox:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-minimal-material-table-demo-center-header?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add mat-sort-header to the demo
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The header should maintain the vertical layout of the words.


#### Actual Behavior
The words are flattened and joined without a space.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.0
- CDK/Material: 8.1.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Adding mat-sort-header breaks the templates flex box layout." (#16952)

Issues.Title: feat(sort): remove hammer dependency
Issues.Body: These changes remove the dependency on Hammer.js from the `matSortHeader`. I decided to remove the `longpress` gesture, rather than implement it with vanilla JS, because it doesn't look like it's worth the trouble. The gesture was meant to show the hover indication if the user holds their pointer on the header, however the touch area is so small that it's most likely that the user won't be able to see the hover indication anyway, because it'll be under their finger. Furthermore, there's nothing indicating to the user that they can long press this element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(sort): remove hammer dependency" (#16951)

Issues.Title: fix(chips): allow null to be set as chip value
Issues.Body:
Allows for the value `null` to be set as the value of a chip. Previously we were treating it as if it's `undefined`, presumably because of a type coercion.

Fixes #16844.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(chips): allow null to be set as chip value" (#16950)

Issues.Title: MatDatepicker ngModel doesn't update from controller
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use a Mat Date Picker with a [(ngModel)]
2. Change the value of ngModel in the controller
 
#### Expected Behavior

The input should have updated the value shown

#### Actual Behavior

The input doesn't actualize

#### Environment

- Angular: 7.0.1
- CDK/Material: 7.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatDatepicker ngModel doesn't update from controller" (#16949)

Issues.Title: ci: test mdc-slider flaky tests on edge 17
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: test mdc-slider flaky tests on edge 17" (#16948)

Issues.Title: build: dev-app should use mdc-theming and mdc-typography mixins
Issues.Body:
Instead of bringing in all theme and typography mixins manually, the dev-app
should use the mdc-theming and mdc-typography mixins. This ensures that
all themes for prototypes are properly added to the `all_theme` and `all_typography`
files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: dev-app should use mdc-theming and mdc-typography mixins" (#16946)

Issues.Title: Example using a mat-checkbox inside a mat-menu
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I'd like to see an example that uses mat-menu with mat-checkbox. There's no easy way to know the right way to implement it. 

In [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55053605/angular-material-checkbox-in-mat-menu-problem-with-dark-themes) there is a suggestion to use this way:

`<mat-checkbox class="mat-menu-item">Problem here</mat-checkbox>`

But using it in the class doesn't feel correct to me, also it doesn't use the property:
```
@Input()
role: 'menuitem' | 'menuitemradio' | 'menuitemcheckbox'
```

**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/components/menu/api
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Example using a mat-checkbox inside a mat-menu" (#16945)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental): add mdc-slider to mdc-theming and mdc-typography
Issues.Body:
Follow-up to the initial implementation of the mdc-slider prototype. This commit
adds the mdc-slider theme and typography to the `mdc-theming` and `mdc-typography`
entry-points, so that consumers don't need to include the slider styles separately.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental): add mdc-slider to mdc-theming and mdc-typography" (#16944)

Issues.Title: adding unique identifier to treenode
Issues.Body:
I create a (flat) tree from my own database. I can add the nodename as a string but this is not unique in my database. How do I add the uniqueID associated with my database record to the tree node as an invisible property?
When I do something to change that node and want to save the changes back to the database, I need to know the uniqueID.

many thanks
John
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "adding unique identifier to treenode" (#16942)

Issues.Title: refactor(form-field): remove unnecessary bindings
Issues.Body: Removes the `mat-accent` and `mat-warn` host bindings from the `mat-form-field` since they're already handled by the `Color` mixin.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(form-field): remove unnecessary bindings" (#16941)

Issues.Title: fix(snack-bar): don't stretch to fullscreen in landscape orientation
Issues.Body:
Currently the breakpoint that determines whether the snack bar should take up the full screen width also includes screens up to 960px in landscape orientation, which ends up looking weird for the short messages that usually got into tooltips.

These changes switch the breakpoint to only be mobile devices in portrait mode.

Fixes #16911.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(snack-bar): don't stretch to fullscreen in landscape orientation" (#16940)

Issues.Title: fix(list): selection list checkbox theme overwritten by parent theme
Issues.Body:
Fixes the theme of the pseudo checkbox inside the `mat-list-option` being overwritten if the list is placed inside of an element that has a different default theme. The issue comes from the default checkbox styles not being specific enough and the selection list not setting a class for `mat-accent`.

Fixes #16891.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(list): selection list checkbox theme overwritten by parent theme" (#16939)
